arts.ttl: Slegers after Real Madrid loss: 'Only half-time'
arts.sum: Arsenal manager Renee Slegers has said she believes that her side can overturn their 2-0 deficit after falling short against Real Madrid in the first leg of the Champions League quarter final.

arts.ttl: Ian Wright fumes over ‘disgrace’ of a pitch as Arsenal lose to Real Madrid
arts.sum: A sodden surface made for a poor spectacle as the hosts secured a 2-0 first-leg advantage in the Women’s Champions League quarter-final

arts.ttl: Arsenal have it all to do after Champions League first-leg loss to Real Madrid
arts.sum: Goals from Linda Caicedo and Athenea del Castillo condemned the Gunners to only their fourth defeat in 23 matches under boss Renee Slegers.

arts.ttl: Real Madrid v Arsenal: Women’s Champions League quarter-final, first leg – live
arts.sum: Updates from first-leg tie, kick-off 5.45pm (GMT) Quarter-final previews | And you can email Sarah 2 min: Both teams are just finding their feet in the early stages of this one but a ball is popped through for Stina Blackstenius, she can’t latch onto it and so Real Madrid can clear. Here we go then. Who will get the upper hand in this tie? All the action to come. It is also still raining in Madrid, a soggy one out there. Continue reading...
